Idea 1: Spec-to-Ship with AI Pair Programming (VS Code + Copilot + ChatGPT)
     * Build a small, production-ready Python library from a plain-English spec using GitHub Copilot and ChatGPT inside VS Code, with tests, docs, and CI.
     * Tools: VS Code, GitHub Copilot/Copilot Chat, ChatGPT, pytest, hypothesis, black/ruff, mypy, Git/GitHub, GitHub Actions.
     * Frameworks and patterns: Spec-Plan-Implement-Test prompting, Rubber-duck error triage prompts, AI-assisted code review checklist.
     * Labs: translate a user story into a typed module; generate unit/property tests first; implement with Copilot; set up CI and coverage; AI-assisted refactor and docstrings; publish to a private repo.
     * Outcomes: measurable time-to-implementation reduction, ≥85% test coverage, typed API surface, reproducible CI pipeline, and a reusable prompt template pack.

Idea 2: AI-Accelerated Data Analysis and Simulation (Jupyter + Copilot + Tabnine + ChatGPT)
     * Supercharge notebooks for data analysis and scientific simulation with AI—vectorize code, fix bottlenecks, and generate visualizations and reports.
     * Tools: JupyterLab/VS Code Notebooks, GitHub Copilot, Tabnine, ChatGPT, NumPy/Pandas/Matplotlib/SciPy, line_profiler/cProfile, nbdev for notebook-to-package workflow.
     * Frameworks and patterns: Spec-Impl-Verify prompt loop, Optimizer pattern for profiling suggestions, “Guardrail prompts” to avoid hallucinated API calls.
     * Labs: load and explore a dataset; AI-suggested feature engineering; simulate an ODE or PDE step; profile and vectorize hot spots; generate an executive-ready notebook report; convert to a tested module with nbdev.
     * Outcomes: 2–3x speedup on a hotspot, reproducible notebook with tests, and a checklist for safe AI use in data/science workflows.

Idea 3: AI-Assisted Refactoring and Porting of Legacy STEM Code
     * Use AI to understand, document, test, and refactor legacy scripts (e.g., MATLAB/R/Fortran/C++ to modern Python), with safeguards to verify correctness.
     * Tools: ChatGPT and Copilot Chat for code explanation, pytest/GoogleTest/MATLAB Unit Testing Framework, mypy/clang-tidy/ruff, Git, diff tooling.
     * Frameworks and patterns: “Explain-Extract-Test-Refactor” pipeline, Golden-master tests for parity, Interface-first porting prompts.
     * Labs: select a legacy function; have AI generate docstrings and call graphs; create characterization tests; refactor for readability and types; optionally port a small component to Python with parity tests.
     * Outcomes: documented before/after diffs, test suite ensuring behavioral equivalence, and a repeatable playbook for de-risked modernization.

Idea 4: Ship a Scientific API in a Day with AI (FastAPI + Copilot + ChatGPT)
     * Wrap a scientific model or algorithm as a secure, documented REST API using AI to scaffold endpoints, validation, tests, and Docker packaging.
     * Tools: FastAPI/Pydantic, Pytest/HTTPX, GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, Uvicorn, Docker, GitHub Actions for CI.
     * Frameworks and patterns: Contract-first prompting (OpenAPI-first), “Spec-Stub-Implement-LoadTest” loop, AI-generated negative tests and schema validation.
     * Labs: define OpenAPI spec; AI-generate FastAPI scaffolding and pydantic models; implement algorithm endpoint; add tests and rate limiting; containerize and smoke-test; optional simple front-end client generation.
     * Outcomes: a working containerized API with tests and CI, OpenAPI docs, and a template repo for future services.

Idea 5: AI-Driven Test-First Development (Property-Based + Mocks)
     * Practice TDD accelerated by AI: generate edge-case and property-based tests first, then implement robust algorithms guided by Copilot/Tabnine.
     * Tools: GitHub Copilot/Tabnine, ChatGPT, pytest, hypothesis, pytest-mock, coverage.py; for C++ tracks, GoogleTest/GoogleMock; for MATLAB, Unit Testing Framework.
     * Frameworks and patterns: “Requirements → Properties → Tests → Code” prompt chain, Failure-first debugging prompts, AI-assisted mutation testing checklist.
     * Labs: choose from algorithmic katas relevant to STEM (e.g., Kalman filter update, PID controller step, Dijkstra); generate properties and tests; implement iteratively; measure coverage and mutation score; add CI.
     * Outcomes: production-grade test suites with high coverage and stronger oracles, a TDD prompt library, and quantified defect detection improvements.
